website_summaries.verdict: Commercial grade heating tape that works on almost any style of roof and roof material.
pros: Includes a 5-year warranty and high quality materials
Usable on metal, asphalt, rubber, and flat roofs, giving it impressive versatility
Also works when installed in gutters
Has a 10-foot cold lead for convenience
cons: Far more expensive than other options
May be more powerful than some people need

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: On our 4th snow storm of the season, and the heat tape is working as it should. Exactly 1 year ago today, we had water damage in one bathroom and one bedroom which was caused by ice dams. This heat tape is not cheap, but it's way cheaper than a complete bathrrom remodel after gutting it to the studs and replacing drywall, carpet, pad, and paint in the adjacent bedroom like I did last year.
customer_reviews.author: nobull

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Heating Cable
customer_reviews.text: This heating cable is of far better quality than other brands I've used. It costs more, but appears to be well worth the extra money. I have a gutter, and drain, on the floor of a second floor rooftop deck that is over my dining room. One year, a cheaper product failed, unbeknownst to me, and the drain was frozen with ice. We got a heavy rainstorm, on Christmas Eve, no less, and the rain, having no where to drain, backed up onto the deck, and leaked down into the living room below. This cable has kept the drain flowing all winter.
customer_reviews.author: jkr

customer_reviews.title: This is some serious heat tape!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Super heavy duty heat tape. Not the easiest to install because it is so thick and stiff. I recommend installing on a warm day or maybe leave it laying out in the sun for a while before installation. You could also plug it in for a bit to warm it up. I replaced some old Frost King heat tape that was easily 10+ years old. This HeatTapePro seem MUCH tougher and I hope it will last even longer and work much better. We've had a couple storms (16 inches of snow) and it seemed to do pretty well. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: VW

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and Well Made
customer_reviews.text: The product is very well made and, although it isn't cold enough yet to test it for melting real ice, it gets quite warm when plugged in. I've laid the tape along the underside of the downspout from my gutter all the way down to where the downspout enters a 40+ foot PVC drain pipe that runs under a rock pile to the street. The tape is fastened to the downspout with cable ties so that it lies directly against the metal downspout and then enters the pipe where it runs inside to just short of the street. The ten foot cold lead is a real advantage allowing me to locate the electrical outlet for it in a convenient location.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Works how it should
customer_reviews.text: This heat tape doesn't take a lot of power and it doesn't get too hot. It melts ice unless it's really cold and there is a lot of wind. I wish I would have used it before my ice dam problems started, but now I have it for next year. I did a little testing and it works just as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I live at 10250 feet in the Colorado Rocky mountains. I have a 100+ year old house with some interesting roof lines. I use this to stop the ice from damming and lifting the metal roofing. It's a good product that is easy to use. If you have basic mechanical ability and are willing g get on your roof you can do it. However if you need a professional the do it they will charge a pretty fair amount to the install this.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the cable after ice and snow accumulated on the roof and gutter therefore overflowing melt onto the walkway making solid ice. We temporarily installed the cable over the iced gutter and plugged it in, within a couple days the ice and snow are draining properly down the downspout. We will purchase another for the roof and garage. Very happy with this product. Wish we had known about it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: It’s fire proof
customer_reviews.text: I like this product,beast cuality,I install them for almost 20years it’s best ,you can cut and splice on other line if you need to
customer_reviews.author: Andy il

customer_reviews.title: High quality, heavy duty heat tape
customer_reviews.text: I used magnets to attach this heat tape to the back side of my satellite dish. I made sure the heat tape was snug against the dish and connected to a 50' extension cord. When ice or snow built up on the dish I plugged in the cord and in a short period of time the ice slid off. Good, heavy-duty heat tape.
customer_reviews.author: mrjmax

customer_reviews.title: 1 winter over and "So Far" I am very happy
customer_reviews.text: HAve had major issues over the last several years with massive Ice Dams, tried roof rakes (Minsnowda) just too heavy and could not get far enough up the roof and impossible in a couple of areas. Did one section where it was the worst problem and it was AMAZING. IF THIS STUFF HOLD UP to the weather I.ll be as happy as a kitten in a catnip patch... I am planning on doing at least one more section this year (maybe two)...
customer_reviews.author: Jahosephat

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: The photo is Feb 2020 and Feb 2019. What an improvement. This product is exactly as described. Excellent performance. We went from 12" ice dams and water damage to no roof ice or leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy, works great
customer_reviews.text: We bought several of these, had ice jams on roofs in winter months, so needed some really sturdy heat tapes. This one is the best, not the cheapest, but really made well and holds up in our northern winters. Easy to install, we used bricks to hold it onto the roof in one place and that worked well also. Flat roof of mobile home worked with this tape and did the job!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma 13

customer_reviews.title: The best on the market
customer_reviews.text: and the most expensive too. Worth every penny. I replaced cheap heat cable with this cable. It should last without taking it down each year. The biggest challenge with any heat cable is determining how long the cable you purchase should be. Read the information on determining length carefully. Make sure to order enough to extend down the downspout at the end.
customer_reviews.author: CleanBookReader

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best ice dam prevention
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best no question. Melted through 6 inch thick ice within 8 hours and than kept the eves and gutters ice free for the rest of the season. Don't waste your money on the cheap junk, buy this and be done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The heat tape did not work. With it plugged in, two inches of snow sat right on top of it, unmelted. Before returning it, we tried calling the toll free number on the enclosed instructions several times. The first few times, we received a recording that the mailbox was full. When we finally "got through" it was to what seemed like a person's VM where we left a message and never heard back. Thankfully Amazon is great about timely returns.
customer_reviews.author: Indymomof4

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived as advertised. I threaded the heat tape down the downspout and through an underground drain pipe to an open evacuation rock baffle near the street. Of course, we haven't had significant freezing here in Colorado Springs since I installed the tape. My previous heat tape (s) failed and that resulted in an ice plug about twenty five feet long the diameter of my 4 inch drain. So I opted for this more robust product and I sure hope it saves me from a repeat of my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Minnesota winter tested!
customer_reviews.text: These work great for Minnesota extreme weather. So far these have eliminated ice dams that have plagued our town house in past years where we have used cheaper heat cables. These are commercial quality in a variety of lengths. They also are self regulating adjusting to changes in outside temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: didn't heat up - I returned it
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a defective unit, but this wire didn't melt any snow. The first day we got abut an inch of snow. It sat on top of this wire and the snow touching the wire didn't melt any faster than the snow just sitting on the roof. I did test before I put it up and I THOUGHT it felt slightly warm. I was wrong, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great, energy efficient and therefore economical heat tape.
customer_reviews.text: I used this heat tape this past winter on a problem area with great results. We live in a ski resort so we have heavy winters. This was an epic year for ice dams that form on the edges of the roof where the melted snow hits the freezing air. I really liked that it plugged into a standard wall outlet and used much less energy than our regular high voltage heat tapes while performing just as well. Bought a second one to use next winter.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall H.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty cable.
customer_reviews.text: Appears very heavy duty and heats up well. Have not installed yet, so will update review after we see how it holds up to the average 2 feet of snow on roof this winter. Much better construction than cheaper brands we checked out at hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: fishinbug

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Our gutters and downspouts continued to freeze this last winter. After getting placing this, it stopped. Highly recommend! Easy to install and does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: way better than big box store
customer_reviews.text: These heat cables are the best. Very easy to install since they come pre-terminated. Very sturdy. I've only had them up a year but I expect them to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Incanus

customer_reviews.title: Ready for winter
customer_reviews.text: Here’s hoping it works this winter. I used gutter screws to fasten the roof clips to the gutter guard. The gutter guard iced up last year and caused ice cycles and prevented drainage. I ran it down the downspout and will plug it in at the outdoor outlet. Easy install!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ruesink

customer_reviews.title: Plug failure
customer_reviews.text: Plug gave out after 2 years...says 5 year warranty but after contacting the seller I have heard nothing. Not happy...
customer_reviews.author: Dennis N Merrick Sr

customer_reviews.title: Very Heavy duty, not cheep and flimsy. Will go for numerous winters.
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! Lined my roof in an area where ice dams can form and create leeks in my home......but not with heat tape/cable. Works like a dream!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome and pricey... no clips included
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to lay out as it is very thick and stiff Did not come with installation clips and were hard to find and very expensive Waiting to see how well it works this winter
customer_reviews.author: Jo A Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Item seems to be great quality. I cannot istall yet due to an ice dam in the way imagine that. But I'll make winter my bitch next year. I need to return it for a longer one so ensure you think that through unlike me.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: READ THE BIO ON THE MAKER
customer_reviews.text: FAST DELIVERY AND PRODUCT MATERIALS SEEM TO BE TOP QUALITY. I LINED MY GUTTERS WITH IT. PUT THIS IN WHILE IT WAS WARM OUTSIDE ,EASIER TO WORK WITH, SEEMS TO BE MUCH BETTER THAN WHAT MY FRIENDS BOUGHT. Will update the review when we get the 10 below zero weather and 2 feet of snow. that will test this product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. It seemed quite expensive, but I'm half a winter in with no issues. It does exactly what I expect this product to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Works great Much better than the frost king stuff at home depot.
customer_reviews.author: Idahobill

customer_reviews.title: Verry pleased, will order more
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well, price is high but my Dad always told me "You get what you pay for ", plan on buying more for the back roof.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Good quality product. Great value. Well be using again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Zeezoh

customer_reviews.title: Kiss ice dams goodbye!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Installed directly in gutters and downspout this prevented ice dams I've been getting for 40 years......best investment I've made to cure ice dams.
customer_reviews.author: J L

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the stuff you can find in the box stores.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this while it is still warm so I will have to see how it does this winter. This heat tape looks like the real deal. It is heavy duty and the grip clips make install a breeze! I installed two 100 foot sections in just a few hours as I did not have to fumble with a hammer and nails. Looking forward to seeing some ice melt this winter.
customer_reviews.author: R. Seag

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for outdoor pipe protection
customer_reviews.text: These are great, we live in a region with occasional freezes, to be safe we bought a few of these and plug them in during cold spells to protect outdoor above ground water pipes and sprinkler valves
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Amazon should drop them.  Bad customer service!
customer_reviews.text: This company does not take care of there customers. I had a problem the heat tape and I did everything they ask me and then I didn’t hear from them again . I have called 7 times and still won’t return my call! Don’t do any business with them. They are not a good company’s decision the product was 500.00 and it worked for 2 months and has a 5 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Marie Chaffin

customer_reviews.title: High quality heat tape, better to use than cheaper stuff.
customer_reviews.text: We live in north Idaho snow country. I installed this same heat tape last year, worked great, now I bought another roll for other areas of my house. Great product and vendor provides excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy K

customer_reviews.title: Additional Info...
customer_reviews.text: Please see the accompanying pictures for additional info. This is info I couldn't find before purchasing, but thought would be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Wash

customer_reviews.title: doing the job
customer_reviews.text: This is our second winter with this product and it's doing the job! keeps ice dams from forming on the roof. very happy -- should help our roof tiles last through hard utah winters
customer_reviews.author: kimberly Grant

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did the trick in the harsh 2018 winter / spring storms
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: works so far.. but it ain't the deep winter here in WI yet.
customer_reviews.text: quality product...don't wait for the snow to fly before plugging it in. looks to work best to prevent ice dams. time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Relsberg

customer_reviews.title: Easy intallation
customer_reviews.text: Don`t have to worry about ice dams in gutters or down spouts anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: While more expensive than what the "big box" retailers carry, the ratings and the very detailed and helpful information provided by the company (Radiant) on their website convinced me to buy this. The cable and clips were high quality and very easy to install. I would buy again and recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: theflicka

customer_reviews.title: Heavy gauge quality product
customer_reviews.text: Installed these this summer ... will Have to wait this winter to see how well it works and whether they prevent ice dams
customer_reviews.author: MTFBWY

customer_reviews.title: Drain pipe outlet defreezer
customer_reviews.text: Use this threaded up into the outlet of a water runoff drain pipe. No freeze clogging since installation. Well made, should be durable (can't say for sure, only used this tear, so far).
customer_reviews.author: Ralph D. Blakeslee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have previously used this product and it is the best I have found. I live at the 5000 foot elevation in Idaho and we get a lot of snow and ICE DAMS.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Klobucher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Kept the eaves & gutters from turning into gutter destroying blocks of ice this year!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: I don't know yet!
customer_reviews.text: I am waiting unti after my house is painted next week to have my handyman install it. We usually have snow into April and I'm excited as this will alleviate a dangerous spot for me as an old lady!
customer_reviews.author: Tenacious Teri

customer_reviews.title: Just enough heat to solve problem without being over powering.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, solved our icing problem. Will store away for the season and get it back out next fall to be ready for the first snow. Thanks Hugh
customer_reviews.author: HC in Nebraska

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly easy to install in roof gutters
customer_reviews.text: It works well. Obviously high quality, surprisingly easy to install in roof gutters, like the plug and play design with power indicator light built into plug. Have recommended it to several neighbors who experienced expensive and extensive home damage due to ice dams/interior leakage this winter here in Bend, OR (25 year record snowfalls in December and January of 60 inches).
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: We got this to melt the ice near our garage door. Did a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Devorss

customer_reviews.title: dependable, ? time will tell as this is deicing cable. and its June now,
customer_reviews.text: size, feel, of product! i look forward to winter knowing this is installed and ready to go the power light in cord end, perfect! thanks for a quality product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than what's available at big box stores
customer_reviews.text: I am a roofing contractor, and I refuse to install the thinner gauges of heat tape available at big box stores on my clients' roofs. This heat tape kept its shape once installed, and worked flawlessly when we tested it. I will absolutely be a long-term return customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ice free gutters
customer_reviews.text: Continual problem with Leaf Guard gutters freezing solid is no longer!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Borree

customer_reviews.title: self regulating
customer_reviews.text: I thought it wood come with clips but not so I came up with a way to attach it to my metal roof. Uther then that it up good. I well be buying more this month. Thanks Terry
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Heat tape purchase
customer_reviews.text: Must learn the correct formula to know how to install, the heat tape, and length needed. The service team answers quickly and is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Frank E Austin

customer_reviews.title: Paid the premium, good so far
customer_reviews.text: Works well, totally removes ice dams and lowered winter stress...won’t know if worth the premium for a few years
customer_reviews.author: Brad Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Service!
customer_reviews.text: Great seller communication and solid product. This heat cable goes above and beyond its competition and with a reputable seller, its a combination that can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: BLJ

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you plug it in.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know how well this works it’s not cold enough yet. Hope it works for what I need this for.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie Jo Bingeman

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great support
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great support. I have both the 220 and 110 versions. I loved the one with the prewired plug. Get the roof clips!
customer_reviews.author: EMF

customer_reviews.title: How it works.
customer_reviews.text: The heat tape is working just fine. It is really a fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin J.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty cables. Really easy to put up. Got them up before the show.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Installed heat cable in gutter and downspout. Project was made easy by this high-quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: Many applications
customer_reviews.text: Just used product toWrap plumb in garage area for space over garage. Excellent product so far,
customer_reviews.author: sandra j.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet had a chance to install this properly on the roof yet but its clear this is a far superior product to similar (cheaper) heat tapes that I have tried. Does appear to be much higher quality, properly sealed, good clear installation instructions and on a quick test on a big ice dam, cleared it within 12 hours. I think this will last years rather than the 2-3 weeks I got out of cheaper ones available.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Watt

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I own a rain gutter business and install ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I own a rain gutter business and install many ice melt systems and heat cables in rain gutters and on roof eaves. Radiant Solutions Company surpasses expectations with there product and by far customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Heat tape was what I expected but am waiting for the snow/ice to see how it works this winter.
customer_reviews.author: DAK

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Plug cable in first and heat it up then install it as it is more pliable. Verry good quality and worked great with last large snow storm in Northeast. Hope it works for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: TS12345

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. We have hard wired heat tapes, and bought this to supplement a valley that had significant ice dam. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia L. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I made an error in my length calculation and had to make an exchange. It was handled very efficiently. Seems to be a good product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: VERY easy to install! I never thought I would need this product but it's working exactly as promised!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roof Clips
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with the roof clips. Was a little disappointed with that, but the tape is in and seems to be working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L Thurston

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK.  NO HEAT AND PIPES FROZE
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE! HEAT TAPE DOES NOT WORK! Heat tape was totally ineffective. Tape produced very small amount of warmth. Almost indetectable. Wrapped insulation around the pipes and tape but pipes froze! Plug lights up when plugged into electric socket. Tape material is heavy duty but that is irelevant if it does not produces any heat.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R Brock

customer_reviews.title: Quality Tape - but EXPENSIVE
customer_reviews.text: The Heat Tape appears to be of high quality and I anticipate it will work just fine. I rated it at a three because I believe it is completely over priced. I would not purchase this item again at this price.
customer_reviews.author: BigB1997

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing for preventing ice dams. Melts snow and ice quick
customer_reviews.author: Ethan S.

product_meta.title: Grip Clip Heat Tape Pro for Ice Dam Prevention Heavy Duty - Self-Regulating - Plug-in Ready Heat Cable - 120V, 6 watts/FT (18 Feet + 10 Foot Cold Lead)
product_meta.description: Size:18 FeetWe have actual humans available by phone. Heat cable is technical stuff and it’s great to have solid advice on how to install it for your ice dam prevention project. We are the only heat cable seller on Amazon who is a simple phone call away 877-387-4218. Eat that impersonal, off shore competitors! Our cables are bad ass and so is our customer service. We’re not sure if we can swear on Amazon, but we just did. Radiant Solutions Company is a direct-to-consumer manufacturer with over 25 years in the business of ice dam prevention. Unlike cheap cables, Heat Tape Pro can be overlapped during installation, can be installed on flat roofs, metal roofs and rubber roofs, will not light leaves on fire under any circumstance and operates effectively when it’s 15 degrees or colder outside. Oh, and Heat Tape Pro is self-regulating, meaning it ‘asks’ for more energy as it gets colder outside and less energy when it’s warmer. The entire length of the cable is temperature sensitive such that colder areas demand more power than warmer areas. Hence the term “Self-Regulating”. Heat Tape Pro is serious stuff and holding it in your hand will tell you as much. It’s a worry-free, long term solution to your ice dam problems. Our cable creates melted pathways through ice or snow on your roof that allow water to escape instead of backing up through your roof system. Problem solved. Heat Tape Pro can be used for roof and gutter de-icing as well as pipe freeze protection. It’s suitable on pipes as small as ½” in diameter and can be used on both metal and plastic pipes. Be sure to order recommended installation accessories including Roof Clips and Downspout Hangers if needed.Product Description
feature_bullets: AMERICAN SUPPORT: Knowledgeable, Minnesota-based company with expert support staff you can actually speak to about ice dam prevention. We are excited to help! Email us at info@radiantsolutionscompany.com
USES: For use on flat roofs, metal roofs, asphalt roofs, rubber roofs and more.
HEAVY DUTY: Heat Tape Pro is a commercial-grade self-regulating heat cable that substantially outperforms cheap cables such as EasyHeat and FrostKing.
WARRANTY: Best-in-Industry 5 year warranty - ETL Listed - WILL NOT short or burnout if cable is overlapped and can be used on flat roofs and metal roofs, unlike cheap cables.
HEADS UP! Please don’t forget to order Radiant Solutions Company Roof Clips with this product - visit www.heattapecalculator.com for cable length and accessory recommendations.
